review.title: Rude staff; crammed parking lot
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was rude until I sarcastically told them I'd write them a "great" review on Expedia...then they calmed down a bit.  I partially blame my Expedia App on my phone when I booked the room, but that's a separate issue.  Room was very clean, but the bathroom could use a little work to modernize things.  Parking lot had very tight quarters to squeeze into.  Could barely get out of the vehicle without touching the car next to me or being blocked by a pole or wall.
review.negativeRemarks: front desk staff, but I put partial blame on Expedia App on my phone for the mix up on check-in
review.locationRemarks: restaurants & gas stations within a few minutes, very close to interstate & airport

review.reviewText: The hotel was very dirty inside including mold in the shower and I made the mistake of looking under the sheets at the mattress covering which was stained.  I am sorry to say I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone

Booked this hotel weeks in advance, and I called weeks in advance also to clairify their late check in policy, explained to the desk my
Flight times and when I would be arriving. He told me that that wouldn't be a problem to check in that late. Once I arrived at the front desk, I was told that I did not have a booking and that there was nothing available. I explained that I had already paid for my room and made the reservation well in advance, and that I also called weeks ago and explained what time I would be arriving. The man working the desk was very rude to me when I was asking for his help and if he had any suggestions on where I should go. He also ignored and walked away from me, so I was left to call Expedia customer service who although were nice, were not much help due to all of the hotels in the area being sold out. I have been assured that I will receive a refund but have yet to.

review.title: Not the best area.
review.reviewText: Not the best area, ok for a night but relativley high risk area and right beside and below freeway. Way over priced for area and room.

review.title: My punishment for goofing up my travel plans
review.reviewText:
Needing to stay in this hotel was my punishment for making a mistake in my travel plans. Got it at the last minute on Saturday night.

Wow.... what a dump...and Expedia made me pay a high price to stay in a place that most travels would avoid at all cost. Other nearby "Nice" hotels were about the same price... just sold out.

On the good side:  My car was not stolen or damaged, Did not get bed bugs (that i know of yet), we were close to the airport.  My hurt knee (from going downstairs with heavy suitcases due to no elevator) is better now... The staircase was very steep and narrow... Surprised it even meets hotel building codes... was more like a fire escape than stairs.

On the bright side:  The same gentleman that checked us in late Saturday night and then checked us out 8 hours later in the morning was very nice and professional.
review.positiveRemarks: Not sure what this building was originally built for...but it certainly was not meant to be a hotel.  Major creativity was needed to convert it.
review.negativeRemarks: get an elevator, new room carpet, shower curtain with less mold stains, clean behind the furniture (a power adaptor fell behind the night stand..yuk!

review.title: Ridiculous Stay at a 2.8 hotel!
review.reviewText: I had to pay a deposit of $100 and my credit card did not have a chip so I had to go and get cash out in order to get my room because the staff member said in order to reserve the room every credit card has a chip and with the one I had it was not possible. This is ridiculous because I travel all the time especially to Hawaii and NEVER had this Experience! Talk about Inconvenience... It's not even a 5star hotel! I reserved this room last minute but will NOT be going there again! Customer Service is a Big Part of Business!

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Tight parking, inconvenient. noisy freeway. noisy air conditioner. rundown bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: location

review.title: sufficient for 1 night
review.reviewText: This hotel is not that bad. I was not scared to stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: A/C worked, TV and cable worked, wifi worked
review.negativeRemarks: the wall behind the toilet could be repaired

review.title: Nicely painted and trimmed, but tiny.
review.reviewText: Nicely painted and trimmed but really more of a small and crowded cubbyhole.

review.title: Not a good place.
review.reviewText: I was forced to stay here because I needed a hotel last minute and the only rooms available elsewhere were very expensive.

review.title: Great and clear hotel
review.reviewText:
Clear facility.
Spacey room.
Parking space a little small.
Breakfast is very simple, but acceptable.
Overall is very good, I would like stay again.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Its a motel. Low expectation, but very noisy. Cars and doors.

review.title: calm place not far from the Airport
review.reviewText:
1. Staff was so nice and helpful. 
When I needed to print out some extra CV the person at the front desk helped opening a way of dealing with the situation.
2. Room delivery was so quick and the served food was hot and delicious.
3. Breakfast bread or serial included fruit juice, tea,milk, yogurt and milk on top of both decaf and normal coffee. 
4.Overall it was cheap and good enough with a thorough cleanliness!

review.title: It's awkward
review.reviewText: Cheapest hotel close to airport saved me from crossing Bay Bridge at rush hour. Not easy to access but easier to leave. This well worn hotel has an Eighties feel to it that is quaint but not comfortable. Still, the price is right for the area.

review.title: Run down and dirty
review.reviewText:
Run down, dirty, drug dealers and hookers abound.
Overpriced 
Rude staff
Beware!!!!!
You've been warned
.......
.......
Didn't feel safe at all

review.title: outside looks deceiving
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised at the comfort and cleanliness of the room . The lot was small the lobby rundown , not close to any food , buding looked like crap but room was very very nicely appointed Nd comfortable and clean

review.title: Worst hotel ever
review.reviewText: Worst place we've ever stayed. If there wasn't the " no refund " clause in booking this place we would have stayed night in car on side of road, that's how bad it was. A/C did not work, large wood valance for curtain fell on me injured arm. Reported to front desk, they told me "we didn't see it happen" you must have did it somewhere else. Holes in walls in bathroom and no hot water.

review.title: Very smelly Floor very dirty Used shoes @ all time
review.reviewText:
Will neve use this place any more.
We vent there only because all normal places were full. I would not go there even if I would need to sleep in my car again. I only did stay there because I have three kids and we would not fit in the car sleeping.

The cleanness of room is not bad. But the hotel is just next to the freeway and the air conditioner was a bit noisy.

Seems there was no fitness room.

Considering its price, it's not a bad choice.

review.title: Cheap Room
review.reviewText: Room was clean.  Smokers and their ashes everywhere--not pleasant.  Windows were tough to open.
review.positiveRemarks: Cheap.  Appreciated the attendant warning of a $50 charge if I smoked in the room.  Proved to be an effective deterrent!
review.negativeRemarks: Disallow smoking on the property.

review.title: ugh
review.reviewText: There was a crack pipe in the parking lot... that about sums up the place.
bad customer service. Rude check in person. moldy bathroom. poor conditions
review.negativeRemarks: everything

review.reviewText: Not the best hotel but comfortable for the price. Got woken up a night from Boise outside. Walls are very thin.

review.title: It's ok
review.reviewText: The cleaners always knocking out door though we're not ready yet to go

review.title: Dirty room and bad smell
review.reviewText: The worst hotel I have ever been, dirty, bad smell.

review.title: Very Low quality for the cost,
review.reviewText:
No Parking,
Very Old building,
Bad neighborhood, 
Very Old towels,
Small rooms
Duty bathrooms,
review.negativeRemarks: You could buy or rent the back land for extra parking & some nice gardens....
review.locationRemarks: the view trough the windows is ugly

review.title: Okay when there's nothing else
review.reviewText:
The bed and room were nice. It looked nice, the bed was comfortable, but the walls were thin and sounds carried from other rooms. Some of the fixtures were oily, which was somewhat disturbing. The deadbolt did not function correctly.
The bathroom was decent, but it was certainly more worn than the rest of the room. It was mostly clean (the dryer looked terrible), but the drain wouldn't stay fully open. One plus was that while the shower head wasn't above my 6'3" height, it was at least high enough to rinse my hair without too much strain.
The view, while not usually a priority for me, was sort of dull as an empty lot with some abandoned looking structures. Speaking of lots, the parking lot has a massive hole in it (20 ft?). 
The breakfast is a short counter in the cramped office. Waffles, pastries, toast, yogurt, juice, and coffee are okay, but don't compare to similarly priced hotels especially considering the other corners cut around the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The freeway and air traffic noise were not an issue, especially given their proximity. The rooms were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise carried way too much between rooms. Rooms could use maintenance, especially in the bathroom, and cleaning could be improved.

review.title: Would not recommend
review.reviewText:
Just spent 9 days doing San Francisco to LA we were picking our rental car up late so I wanted somewhere close to the airport I figured for £100 as a quick stop over it would be fine. It was more expensive than the gorgeous Embassy Suites we stayed at LAX for £91 and other places yet it the worst place we stayed during our whole 3 week trip. 

It wasn't very clean, the bedding didn't smell clean, breakfast was very basic. Would not recommend.

We got there and we couldn't park because the parking space was too tight. To add it up, our family got really creeped out by the rest of the surroundings and neighborhood. It kind of smelled in the room too.
It is terribly hard to find and if you go to downtown San Mateo to eat it's even harder to get back to it. The personnel seems largely disinterested in the well being of the guest.
review.negativeRemarks: Attitudes, cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: It is located directly at a freeway, separated by a sound barrier. Nothing desirable appears to be close enough for somebody not familiar with the are

review.title: Below Average
review.reviewText: The hotel was less than average! I asked the staff if they can give me a different accommodation but said there's no more available room but we just saw the housekeeper just done cleaning the room! I said I am willing to pay for the extra but she just smiled and said no!

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText:
I got in late and my reservation was pulled up right away.

The room was clean and comfy. The noise from the freeway was not an issue.

I slept like baby and made my early flight the next day no problem.

review.title: It is convenient although not as clean as expected
review.reviewText: It is my first time to book hotel through expedia. I found it hard to book two different rooms as desired. There is no option to book two different rooms with one order

review.title: Old
review.reviewText: Its an old run down hotel in a creepy neighborhood, bathrooms need renos there's mold in the sillicon. Good for one or two nights but not a long term place, the train station was a pretty good walk away.

review.title: It Will Do.
review.reviewText:
It was an OK stay. The only reason why we stayed there was because it was close to the car rental place that we rented from.
The breakfast sucked. When a breakfast is advertised one expects a decent breakfast but, with no eggs and no fresh coffee, pretty basic stuff.
review.positiveRemarks: It's proximity to the car rental place.
review.negativeRemarks: They could provide a decent breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Haven't a clue. Quite burned out when we arrived, ordered room service, crashed.

review.title: Good motel, close to SFO airport
review.reviewText: Stayed here the night before a early morning flight at SFO in order to save time in the morning.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and had a big tv, microwave, and mini fridge
review.negativeRemarks: lightening in the room was a bit dark

review.title: Looking for a reasonable price in the SF area
review.reviewText: Looking for something around $100 in the SF area. It was clean and quiet. Breakfast minimal.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, quality of coffee in the room - bad

review.title: Nice room .
review.reviewText: I liked the room. I was pleasantly suprised after seeing the outside.
review.positiveRemarks: The room. Nice, clean and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Fixe the cofee machine. I only stayed one night.can't say much
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport. Pretty isolated.

review.title: Comfy motel, close to transportation
review.reviewText: Really affordable motel. Close to transportion so easy to travel around if you have no car. Maids are friendly and kind. The manager doesn't bother you at all. The rooms are big enough and comfy however our bathroom door didn't lock. Our window view wasn't great, but it was really worth the stay
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast service.
review.locationRemarks: You're 23minutes away from the shopping center if you walk or 10 minutes away on bus. Jack in the box near by and also a supermarket

review.title: Stayed one night
review.reviewText:
Only booked one night because I thought the price to location wasn't good enough...it was a little too pricey.
I have stayed at other Super 8 locations in California and had better experiences.
review.positiveRemarks: Freeway access was good and close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: This location could use some "refreshing" as it's getting run down looking.
review.locationRemarks: There is a shoreline trail and park that is nearby. A couple of local convenience stores are also close by.

review.title: close to the airport
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to the airport and was a last-minute reservation. Bathroom was really dirty. We were happy to be on our way.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to airport. Waffles in the lobby made good fast breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was not very clean and the bathroom was really dirty. The entire place had a dark and dingy look.
review.locationRemarks: Located on a side street adjacent to several low-rent hotels. Nothing to do within walking distance that we could see.

review.title: Apart from proximity to SFO this motel was aweful
review.reviewText: The room smelt of urine the moment I entered and was not well cleaned. I was forced to sleep for the few hours I managed to on top of the bedcovers to avoid some of the smell. Really badly maintained room, wifi connection details not available in room and TV HBO channels not accessible despite HBO film brochure in the room. This wasn't worth 20$ let alone the actual charged rate of 95$. But for the proximity to SFO this motel has no plus points.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean rooms and disinfect beds - replace mattresses clearly that were fouled.
review.locationRemarks: Near SFO so totally overpriced for the service quality

review.title: Emergency accommodation
review.reviewText: This is an awful motel, well past its prime and in a bad location. We used it only because we had no choice following the shutdown of San Francisco airport and every hotel we tried was full, so by 10.30 pm we were desperate.... it WAS better than sleeping on the airport floor though.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: it is nice
review.reviewText: The room is big with refrigerator and microwave oven. The bed are comfortbal. And it is near the train station.
review.negativeRemarks: shuttle to airport.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText:
Best motel I ever stayed in.
excellent
Very clean,nice staff,family owned which I mostly like

review.title: Location was behind the junk yard
review.reviewText: Kept our curtain always closed, and breakfast was poor
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the junk yard behind the hotel and breakfast

review.title: San Mateo Nightmare!
review.reviewText:
It was a damned motel!
I was surprised they didn't have hourly rates.

review.title: not a family motel.
review.reviewText: The room had hot cheetos on the floor when I walked over to the a/c unit. The bathroom had a nicotine patch on bathroom wall and after showering it smelled funky like maybe they should try bleaching the walls. I expected a clean and nice smelling room.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Clean room, nice people, didn't really spend more than a few hours at the hotel to sleep, so can't really say more

review.title: bad condition and bad service
review.reviewText:
First, the room condition is very bad. There is a broken power outlet on the wall and all wires exposed. The sink is leaking. The dryer is broken and never works.

Second, the room is dirty. I took off my shoes and walked on the carpet. Two minutes later, I can clearly see my turn dark. I doubted if the house keeper even vacuumed the room after the previous guest left.

Thirdly, this hotel provides free internet connection. But the signal is very weak and unstable. During two days, i only had about 30 mins to use internet.

Fourth, the front desk staff was not helpful. When I asked for help regarding the internet connection problem, she said she could not do anything because no other people complained this.

Fifth, the parking lot is EXTREMELY small and tight. It might take you 10-15 mins to park your car in an appropriate position. Also, you will find problem in open your door as another car was just half feet away besides your car.

Finally, the breakfast is insufficient. Although it is available from 6-9am. But normally, there is nothing left around 8:40am. I went there two mornings at 8:40am, and found out that only juice left. The front desk staff did not add any new items. The breakfast desk is besides the front desk. There are very limited items. Also, you have to bring the breakfast back to your room as there is no space for eating at all.

review.title: Never go there!
review.reviewText:
A very bad example of a super 8 motel! ...and I wonder who wrote the good reviews? the manager himself?
About 50% of the rooms were former smoking rooms...and they smell terribly! There is even a sign in the room that "the room has been cleaned to remove tobacco odor", which was obviously not efficient at all. After a long discussion with the very unfriendly staff, we changed the room for the remaining 2 nights (3 in total). Additionally, the rooms are not clean: if you walk barefoot, your feet are becoming black!
Even the "internet in every room" is a joke! Wifi works only in the "lobby" and even there very slowly.
In SUMMARY: DON'T GO THERE, it's disgusting and a very bad experience!

review.title: Find Somewhere else
review.reviewText: Normally i don't fill these out but this place makes me want to warn others. Very bad place. The phone in the room didnt work, the neighborhood wasn't the best but that's ok. The front counter people are very unfriendly and don't even talk to you but act bothered. The morning coffee is gone.. MOST of all.. DONT take your shoes off! My socks were so black I actually just threw them out. its one step up from sleeping in the car...I cant beleive I even weigh the two. There are too many places right in the area that's so much better for the same price. That's the downside of Expedia.. bad bad place :(

review.title: OK for a night
review.reviewText: The room was clean. The neighborhood is okay.

review.title: A Good Place to Stay.
review.reviewText: The only issue I might have with this hotel is that they had free WiFi. We could never use it because it did not reach to our room. I talked to the manager about it and they said they would have someone check it, but it never changed. Everything else was good.

review.title: Great place to stay near our son.
review.reviewText: It was excellent.

review.title: its okay...
review.reviewText: but nothing special -its okay for the price, if you just need a place to sleep in...

review.title: If you want to use Wi Fi, don't select this motel.
review.reviewText: Unable to connect Wi Fi inside motel room

review.title: Average Motel off the 101
review.reviewText: Nothing really spectacular about this particular motel. Not a whole lot of places to park, and what was there was a narrow car port that made loading passengers difficult while parked. Room was decent, the free Wi-Fi was a plus but didn't seem to work as well with HP laptops as it does with Dell ones. Bed was reasonably comfortable, and while I'd go back for sure, I'd be just as likely to try somewhere new.

review.title: Not as ghetto as it looks
review.reviewText: At night, especially with the construction near by and the fact that there's no one around might make this place look extremely ghetto. But it's not, don't worry. It's right next to an elementary school and a few apartment complex. The price is reasonable and the owners are nice. If you are looking for a cheap stay, this is the place.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: good value, free wireless internet
